column5: aplumma's dog is right. we should listen to him. it worked for the zodiac killer
these days i call them zander just to mess with the locals.
Let me get this staight... a wall eye is nothing but a mounted pickerel?
:rofl2:

Would not work even if they wanted to try. They have been similar efforts in the past to wipe out established invasive species, never works. Once they are there it is too late. They are harmful fish when they are invasive but once they are in, start working on the next lake.  Most pike in Balsam are 3 inches long, not 3 feet, hard to wipe out non-angling size fish with regular tackle.  The good news is the wallee population  has come back nicely in Balsam, you might even find some pickeral or Dore in there depending on what generation or province you come from.  Watch out for the pike perch and you may catch the elusive logperch if your lucky.  http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/460315/pike-perch  http://www.rook.org/earl/bwca/nature/fish/percinacap.html
My dad calls them pickerel, so that's what they are
And what about Sauger????????  I had a delicious feed of Lake Nipissing Pickeral tonight. Mmmmmmmmmmmmmmm.
the walleyemaster still lives on

Funny they didn't know the other types of Trout, just Lake Trout and Rainbow. Where did all the Black Bass go? Small Mouth and Large Mouth must be an invasive species. Black Bass Tournaments, is that like a Rock Bass Tournament. Black Bass Boat Pickerel Boat Black Dacron line and the old Pal minnow bucket 1941, the good old days.
PICKERAL       pickerel (pickerel (walleye))     Just saying  Nice LOL

North of French River - pickeral South of French River and U.S.A. - walleye Uber Sophisticated Fisherpeople - Dore (making something 'French' sounding adds a touch of distinction and can generally be used to sell concepts to female partners - French windows, French dressing, French doors, French urinals..)
Now I'm totally confused....the last one I caught said "Made in China" on it....
Wow! I just got my April 1941 issue yesterday too! Good ole Canada Post
I don't trust Art's dog... I wanna here what the goat has to say on this! HH
So, TJ, you had that subscription since what, 12 or 13 years of age?  Walleye FTW!
Art
HH
Don't believe everything the dog tells you Art, the other night when I was talking to him he said he was messing with you.
Exactly, where I grew up a pickerel is the top picture. How can you call something what it isn't? My truck is a Dodge but who's the moron if you call it a Ford?

In 1941 the name Walleye was still a pretty new handle for what was called most often a pickeral.  http://www.ontariowalleyefishing.com/walleye-biology.html  Fishing Lake Erie out of Port Colborne in the 50's with my dad, he simply referred to them as Yellows and Blues, short for Yellow and Blue Pickeral, the Americans just the other side of the Peace Bridge called them yellow and blue pike. Dad was darn good pickeral fisherman, he always trolled with a Pfluger " Rocket" trolling reel loaded with about 15 lb. monel wire, 3 way swivel , appropriate weight on a dropper and usually either a June Bug spinner or a Gibb's Tee-Spoon spinner with a crawler on a longish lead. He'd produce fish all summer even when others couldn't get down to them.
And the Junebug, as old as it is , is still an excellent bait.

I got a few of those Junebug spinners in the old tackle box i brought home with me last time i went home. Going back up in 2 weeks to clean out Dads old workshop. Mom is giving me everything in it.That should be good for a few tears
Maybe we could just call them..Wickeral or......Palleye????? LOL

I was browsing through a recent issue of Field and Stream Magazine, a US based publication, also known the FOX News of Outdoor magazines (.. ok maybe that is a bad example...)  I came across an insert on the years Canadian Fishing Regulations.. and lo and behold there is no mention of the imposter "walleye", but only the venerable mighty "pickerel" is mentioned.  Hmmfff.. CASE CLOSED    www.pickerelcentral.com "Long Live the Mighty Canadian Pickerel"
Thanks for putting it to bed once and for all Boss !!
I lol'd at the Field and Stream, the FOX news of outdoors magazines.  So funny
Sorry boss, but it's a Pickereye! They obviously can't spell in that rag! HH
Very Cool TJ, but which is it. I grew up listening to Dad calling them Pickerel. His Dad too. In Quebec its Dore, i believe from D'or Oeil, meaning Golden Eye, but not 100% sure of that.
No such thing as pike limits back in the day.
Wow, 7 and half hours from a set of batteries. If my wife had those I would have more time for fishing.
Well thank God that's over

Dore isn't just a Quebec thing. Its the french name for walleye/pickerel. Dore is a colour, golden brown like roasting a marshmallow to perfection (although i like mine charcoal). I find it funny when English people call them Dore and say thats what they are called and get confused when i tell them thats the French word for walleye/pickerel.
It was only a matter of time before the truth came out.  Good sleuthing.
Some ideas (and even some people) evolve over 70 years.
well I knew it all along..  now the mods can ban/qmod anyone that calls them the "W" word instead of PICKEREL
WALLEYE WALLEYE WALLEYE NA NA AND AN EXTRA NA NA TO YOU TOO.
LOL.. you've been around here long enough to know that that simply is not true.
Walleye!
pickerel THATS EXCELLENT ! censor the word w.alleye
I did say "some". Dinosaurs just die out.
walleye, walleye, walleye.  All good here.
The entire Canadian fishing regulations summarized on 1/2 a magazine page. Wish things were that simple again
It's from 1941, just keep on living in the past people. If we don't learn from the mistakes made in the past we are bound to repeat them.
pickerel  musta ate sumfin bad
they got dore from pickerel beeing golden.. d'or=gold=dore(golden in color)
Why would you want to call the mighty walleye such a lousy name as  "pickerel". I even asked my dog this question and he agrees with me on this point.   Art
Pike is open all year in FMZ 17, though there is a limit.
